content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a horizontal in line below the sphincter. Follow slopers and pockets up and out through the sphincter.
content.location: Look for the sphincter at the lip of the left side of the boulder between the two flakes

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a horizontal at the bottom of a small hueco. Move up through a jug and the flake to the top out.
content.location: Starts under the flake on the left side of the wall.

content.description:
Stand Start, Top Out

Follow the flake up to the first lip. Find a hidden sidepull in the crack and finagle your way up and over just left of the point.
content.location: The third flake (from left to right) on the left side of the bou

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Follow the large noticeable flake up and then out over the first ledge. The true top out takes one more step up over the second ledge.
content.location: The second flake (from left to right) on the left side of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit Start, Matched Finish

Start on a sloping ledge. Move up through another ledge and a crimp to a bump into a good pocket. Throw for the next jug and move up matching on the first lip (to the left of the protruding hold to be safe).

I have cleaned top outs for the overhanging face, however for this route the top out seems disproportionately hard and unsafe because the protruding hold at the first lip seems like it may break with weight added. Someone else can add the top out if they want.
content.protection: Bring some pads for the big moves on this one.
content.location: Starts just right of the protruding rock from the base of the face (sit start is on the ground just right of this protruding rock). Finishes just left of the protruding feature at the lip that may break.
